newsitem.title: USA: U.S. agency to question side air bags - report.
newsitem.headline: U.S. agency to question side air bags - report.

text.p: Members of the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) are expected to say in a board meeting Tuesday that passenger-side air bags in automobiles are not needed and in fact contribute to deaths, USA Today reported Monday.

The article, which gave no sources for its information, said the NTSB was also likely to criticise the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) for failing to do more to prevent air-bag injuries and deaths.
The NTSB could recommend the NHTSA drop its requirement for passenger-side air bags, or ask for the installation of switches that disable the bags.
